page.title: 11FAYRE: DANE END & AREA
page.content: On the 18th May, 1985,{Little Munden {School}held an{Anniversary Fayre}to commemorate the{160th anniversary}of the building of the school. There were stalls and competitions, a football and netball tournament with other schools and the main attraction of the day was the{HISTORICAL PAGEANT depicting 160 years of schooling at {LITTLE MUNDEN. {Stalls:}There was a raffle, a cake stall, a toy stall and a craft stall with goods made by parents and children. There was a lucky wheel and if the arrow pointed to your number you could dip in the Lucky Dip. The Pageant: Every child in the school took part in this even if they only had a small part. There was maypole dancing, a reconstruction of Haultwick Fair and Victorian children at school. We raised Â£260 towards a new computer.
